skill.name: tasknotes
skill.description: Manage tasks in Obsidian via TaskNotes plugin API. Use when user wants to create tasks, list tasks, query by status or project, update task status, delete tasks, or check what they need to do.
skill.summary: Manage tasks in Obsidian via TaskNotes plugin API. Use when user wants to create tasks, list tasks, ...
skill.author: ArtemXTech

security_audit.summary: Standard task management tool with minimal risk. Only communicates with local Obsidian API on localhost. Reads specific environment variables for configuration. No dangerous patterns or data exfiltration capabilities detected.

content.user_title: Manage Obsidian tasks via TaskNotes API
content.value_statement: Track and organize tasks directly from your AI assistant. Create, update, and list Obsidian tasks without switching apps. Stay on top of your workload with natural language commands.
actual_capabilities: List all tasks with filters for status, project, and priority
Create new tasks with title, project, priority, due date, and scheduled time
Update existing task status, priority, title, and details
Get task statistics and available filter options
Format output as human-readable tables or JSON for agents
limitations: Requires TaskNotes plugin running in Obsidian with HTTP API enabled
Only works with Obsidian vault on same machine as TaskNotes plugin
Cannot create tasks without Obsidian running and plugin active
API token and port must be configured correctly in settings

use_cases.title: Daily task review
use_cases.description: Check in-progress tasks and plan your day with quick list commands

use_cases.title: Project task tracking
use_cases.description: Create and update tasks linked to specific projects and goals

use_cases.title: Task context storage
use_cases.description: Add detailed descriptions to tasks for better context recall

prompt_templates.title: List tasks
prompt_templates.prompt: List my tasks with status in-progress

prompt_templates.title: Create task

prompt_templates.title: Get options
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me available priorities and statuses for my tasks

output_examples.input: List my tasks with status in-progress --table
output: in-progress      high       Finish landing page                                [[Website Redesign]]
in-progress      medium     Review pull request #42                            [[Codebase Cleanup]]

best_practices: Enable API authentication with a token for secure access
Use --table flag for human-readable output when viewing tasks
Run options command first to see your configured status and priority values
anti_patterns: Using the skill without Obsidian running and TaskNotes API enabled
Attempting to modify tasks in vaults without proper API port configuration
Creating tasks without specifying projects when organization is needed

faq.question: Does this work with Obsidian Mobile?
faq.answer: No. TaskNotes HTTP API requires Obsidian desktop with the plugin installed and running.

faq.question: What happens if the API is unreachable?
faq.answer: The skill returns an error message indicating Obsidian must be running with TaskNotes enabled.

faq.question: Can I use this with multiple vaults?
faq.answer: Configure each vault with a separate .env file containing the correct API port and token.

faq.question: Is my task data sent anywhere?
faq.answer: No. All API calls go to localhost only. Task data never leaves your machine.

faq.question: Why am I getting authentication errors?
faq.answer: Verify TASKNOTES_API_KEY in your .env matches the token set in TaskNotes plugin settings.

faq.question: How is this different from the Tasks plugin?
faq.answer: TaskNotes provides HTTP API access for AI integration while the Tasks plugin handles advanced query syntax.
